comment:
# fish composition of trawls in 10 standard stations of Oneida lake from 1964 to 2018.
# Subset of the data set for standardisation purposes: after 1963, July to October, Only the first survey of each month for each site and then all surveys per year per site are pooled together. Abundances of YOYs and adults are summed.

reference: Lars G. Rudstam. Phytoplankton in Oneida Lake, New York, 1975 to present. Knowledge Network for Biocomplexity. kgordon.31.87.
BioTIME_title: not included yet. BioTIME has Oneida lake data on molluscs (1912-2017) and zooplankton (60s to present)
comment:
# Oneida lake phytoplankton sampled. Standardisation necessary: 2 time periods, each providing somewhat similar values from 5 standard stations
# First time period (1975-1995) samples were taken only from standard stations and we select only values pooled from all 5 stations. This leaves 10 to 22 values per year.
# second time period (1996-2018) samples where taken only from standard stations. The number of stations is not provided and is assumed to be 5 in all occasions. The number of values per year ranges from 8 to 20. After excluding March and December, most if not all months are sampled at least once each year, so subsampling by selecting months does not work. When several surveys were done in a single month, one can be randomly selected so that all years have 8 samples.
# standardisation: keeping one survey per month in June July and August and then pooling per year

reference: Lars G. Rudstam. Zooplankton survey of Oneida Lake, New York, 1964 to present. Knowledge Network for Biocomplexity. kgordon.17.99.
